title: Business Live: Mouse buys Fox - BBC News
summary: walt disney buys 21st century fox assets for $ 52.4bn .
four seasons care home wins breathing space over debt payment .
capita shares fall on `` trading challenge '' warning .

documents.title: good night
text: all good things must come to an end , and that 's it from us for tonight .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on friday with all the latest business news .

documents.title: five thing about the disney deal
text: andrew neil - before he became a bbc presenter - edited the sunday times under rupert murdoch and was the founding chairman at sky .
he 's been sharing his thoughts about what 's behind the disney-fox tie up .
author: Andrew Neil
Presenter, The Daily Politics

documents.title: wall street closes on a low
text: wall street stocks have fallen , as investors worry about potential roadblocks to the republicans ' tax cut plan .
the dow jones ended the day down 0.31 % or 76 points lower at 24,509.07
the s & p 500 is down 0.41 % or 10 points at 2,652.01 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has fallen 0.28 % or 19 points to 6,856.53 .

documents.title: the simpsons can see the future
text: disney announces it has reached a deal to acquire 21st century fox , as predicted by a simpsons episode that first aired on november 8 , 1998 .
so , now that three-eyed fish should wash up on shore any day now , right ?

the falcons losing to the pats in the superbowl

documents.title: more on amazon driver row
text: mps rachel reeves and frank field have written to amazon uk 's managing director douglas gurr , regarding recent media reports that amazon drivers are required to work at least 12 hours a day to keep up with delivery targets .
this is despite the fact that uk law prohibits drivers from working over 11 hours a day .
`` we are also concerned about reports that couriers are receiving below the national living wage once their routine expenses are deducted , '' the mps write in the letter to mr gurr .

`` regardless of the formal status of couriers delivering on behalf of amazon , we would welcome your confirmation that you are investigating these issues and ask that you inform us what actions you are taking to ensure that those couriers contracted to deliver on behalf of your company are working safely and receiving fair pay .

documents.title: world bank arming cities against climate change
text: the world bank has set up a $ 4.5bn scheme to help 150 cities in developing countries keep their infrastructure and communities safe from wilder weather and rising sea levels .
many cities are struggling to pay for measures needed to guard residents and property from threats such as floods , storms and heatwaves , while improving housing and reducing inequality .
the goal of the world bank 's city resilience program is to attract capital from heavyweight investors like pension funds , and to form partnerships with international and local companies .

documents.title: 'no evidence ' that offshoring affects unemployment
text: a study of almost 6,000 multinationals by three universities has found that the process of relocating part of a business to another country has no impact on unemployment .

in fact , since the global financial crisis in 2007-08 , the researchers from warwick business school , university of wollongong and aston university found offshoring led to an uplift in employment for the company on its home soil .

unsubstantiated claims of loss of employment due to offshoring have played a part to the uk voting for brexit and the rise of right wing protectionist governments across the world , so it is imperative that we have some proper evidence on the issue , '' said warwick business school 's professor nigel driffield .

not only is there no evidence of a reduction in employment at home , but on the whole offshoring in these sectors led to an increase in employment at home , particularly after the financial crisis . ''

documents.title: trump supports disney fox deal
text: the white house says that president donald trump backs walt disney 's deal to buy the bulk of 21st century fox 's business for $ 52.4bn .

`` i know that the president spoke with rupert murdoch earlier today , congratulated him on the deal and thinks that , to use one of the president 's favorite words , that this could be a great thing for jobs and certainly looks forward to and hoping to see a lot more of those , '' white house spokeswoman sarah sanders told reporters .

documents.title: why is rupert murdoch selling 21st century fox ?
text: rupert murdoch has given an interview with sky news explaining why he 's decided to sell 21st century fox .
`` i think this is returning to our roots , which is news and sports .
it 's the changing way people watch television these days .
sports and news is huge , but with series , people might watch them a week later , or watch a whole series a year later , '' he said .
`` and you 've got all these big companies , apple , amazon , netflix , investing in making scripted shows and putting up the costs
`` i think it 's strategically the right time and the right move . ''

documents.title: what is net neutrality ?
text: net neutrality is the principle that an internet service provider ( isp ) should give consumers equal access to all legal content regardless of its source .
to put it another way , if the networks which form the bedrock of the internet were a motorway , then under net neutrality , there would n't be fast lanes for cars and slow lanes for lorries .
motorists would n't be able to pay to use a faster route .
all data regardless of its size , is on a level playing field .

in practice what this means is that isps - the biggest ones in the us include comcast , charter and at & t - can not block content , speed up or slow down data from particular websites because they have been paid to do so .
and they ca n't give preferential treatment to their own content at the expense of their competitors .
want to know more ?
here 's a full breakdown .

documents.title: internet protests may have led to this north america technology reporter dave lee tweets
text: one other thing to take from today - us internet is increasingly becoming very different from european internet .
privacy , data protection and now net neutrality .
that does n't mean power and innnovation will shift , tho .
one other way to see it is that us americanet is decidedly more pro-business than european un ionet .
( i 'll work on that one . )
free speech is slowly but surely becoming a privilege for the fortunate across the pond .
sad times .
some of the internet protests clearly did more to harm the # netneutrality cause than help it .
if you shout , harass and threaten people they 're not going to come round to your point of view , and nor should they .

documents.title: bitcoin buyers : be ready to lose all your money
text: the head of one of britain 's leading financial regulators has warned people to be ready to `` lose all their money '' if they invest in bitcoin .
andrew bailey , head of the financial conduct authority , told the bbc that neither central banks nor the government stood behind the `` currency '' and therefore it was not a secure investment .
buying bitcoin , he said , was similar to gambling - and had the same level of risk .
read kamal 's blog here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: new york 's attorney general on the war path
text: new york attorney general eric schneiderman says he is going to lead a multi-state legal challenge to the us federal communications commission 's vote to reverse landmark net neutrality rules from 2015 .

`` today 's new rule would enable isps to charge consumers more to access sites like facebook and twitter and give them the leverage to degrade high quality of video streaming until and unless somebody pays them more money .
even worse , today 's vote would enable isps to favor certain viewpoints over others , '' he said in a statement .
`` new yorkers deserve the right to a free and open internet .
that 's why we will sue to stop the fcc 's illegal rollback of net neutrality . ''

documents.title: breakingnet neutrality rules weakened by us regulator
text: restrictions on us broadband providers ' ability to prioritise one service 's data over another are to be reduced after a vote by a regulator .
the federal communications commission split three to two in favour of changing the way `` net neutrality '' is governed .
internet service providers ( isps ) will now be allowed to speed up or slow down different companies ' data , and charge consumers according to the services they access .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: trump calls murdoch ahead of fox takeover
text: walt disney has agreed to buy 21st century fox 's entertainment assets for a total $ 52.4bn ( £ 39bn ) .
what does all this mean for rupert murdoch , his family and their influence in the uk ?
andrew neil was an important part of the murdoch business empire as editor of the sunday times and helped set up sky television .
he told radio 4 's pm programme it was a `` watershed '' moment .
he also revealed that president trump called rupert murdoch seeking assurances that fox news would not be sold as part of the deal .
author: Radio 4 PM

documents.title: israeli drugmaker to cut 14,000 jobs
text: israel 's teva pharmaceutical industries has announced a restructuring plan that will see it cut 14,000 jobs worldwide , or 25 % of its total workforce .
teva pharmaceuticals : israeli drugmaker to cut 14,000 jobs

documents.title: the pig farmer taking on tesco
text: richard baugh 's family have been raising pigs for three generations at woodside farm in rural nottinghamshire .
but mr baugh says he 's been forced to change the name of his business after tesco rebranded its own label pork products as `` woodside farms '' .
he 's now threatening legal action if the supermarket giant does n't drop its new branding .
`` what bothers me the most is it 's not necessarily british food they 're putting it on , '' says mr baugh , who 's changed his business name to `` bofs hogs '' to differentiate it from tesco .
read the full story here
author: Joshua Cheetham
Business reporter

documents.title: why is unemployment down but benefit claims up ?
text: the unemployment figure we quote includes people who are out of work but not claiming benefits .
but we ca n't say with confidence either that unemployment has fallen or that the number claiming out-of-work benefits has risen .
here 's why .

yesterday 's unemployment figures from the office for national statistics ( ons ) suggested there were about 26,000 fewer people unemployed between august and october than there had been between may and july .
that figure is based on a survey so there is a margin of error involved .
the ons is 95 % confident that the figure for the change in unemployment was right to within plus or minus 77,000 .
as 26,000 is less than 77,000 , we say that the fall in unemployment is not statistically significant .

yesterday 's out-of-work benefit figures estimated that the number of claimants had risen 5,900 in november compared with october , but that needs to be taken with a pinch of salt because problems linked to the transition to universal credit means they have been downgraded to experimental statistics .
@ twitterid how does unemployment fall , when jobseeker allowance claims are rising ?
thanks for the excellent question - here 's the answer :
author: Reality Check

documents.title: breakingmps ask amazon to investigate couriers ' working hours
text: rachel reeves , chair for the business , energy and industrial strategy committee , and frank field , chair for the work and pensions committee , have asked amazon to investigate reports that couriers are having to drive up to 12-14 hours without being given a break .
leading mps frank field and rachel reeves ask amazon to investigate couriers ' driving hours and reports couriers receiving below national living wage after expenses deducted
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: london ends on a low
text: the ftse 100 has closed down 0.65 % or 48.4 points to 7,448.12 , weighed down by losses among financial stocks .
the index 's biggest loser was standard life aberdeen , down 3.27 % to 413.5p , followed by convatec group down 3.1 % to 202.9p , and standard chartered down 1.9 % to 759.4p
the ftse 250 also ended down 0.27 % to 20,006.27 , pulled down by capita , which saw a fall of 12.5 % to 407.9p , pz cussons , down 5.1 % to 311.1p , and provident financial , down 3.5 % to 811p .

documents.title: what can we use quantum computing for ?
text: in order to explore practical applications for quantum computing , ibm is giving 12 fortune 500 companies and academic institutions access to its quantum computing systems .

jp morgan , daimler , samsung , barclays , honda , hitachi metals , jsr corporation , nagase , oxford university , keio university , oak ridge national lab and university of melbourne will have direct access via the cloud to a 20-qubit ibm quantum computing system .

working closely with our clients , together we can begin to explore the ways big and small quantum computing can address previously unsolvable problems applicable to industries such as financial services , automotive or chemistry , '' said dario gil , vice president of ai and ibm q at ibm research .
`` there will be a shared focus on discovering areas of quantum advantage that may lead to commercial , intellectual and societal benefit in the future . ''

documents.title: london now lower
text: the ftse 100 index is now trading 24.28 points lower at 7,472.23 , weighed down by an income fund .
standard life aberdeen is leading the fallers , with its share price down 2.88 % at 415.20p .
convatec , sky and whitbread are also among the biggest losing stocks .
on the ftse 250 , shares are now down 0.14 % to 20,034.29 .
the losers are led by outsourcing firm capita , down 11.3 % to 413.10p on a gloomy trading update that showed a recovery in 2018 is unlikely .

documents.title: natwest updates security after embarrassing blog by security expert
text: natwest bank has been left red-faced after a security expert wrote a blog highlighting how the bank responds when researchers report security bugs to it .
troy hunt and several other researchers told natwest that it needed to start using encrypted https connections on all customer-facing websites , not just online banking .
the bank replied , `` sorry you feel this way '' , prompting mr hunt to write a blog post about it .
read more here .

documents.title: thomas cook considering niki takeover
text: thomas cook says it is now considering making a takeover bid for troubled finnish carrier niki , which has gone into insolvency after lufthansa pulled out of purchasing it due to competition concerns from the european commission .
`` we plan to increase our capacity in the german market in light of the increased demand , '' said a thomas cook spokesman .
`` we are considering our options , including a takeover of niki , or buying parts of the airline . ''

documents.title: oil prices under pressure
text: the international energy agency ( iea ) has increased its forecast for growth in us oil output next year , putting pressure on oil prices .
west texas intermediate futures fell 29 cents to $ 56.31 a barrel , down from a high of $ 56.93 , while brent crude futures were at flat at $ 62.45 a barrel .

`` the iea underlined the same take that the us energy department had the day before yesterday and opec had yesterday , '' said bjarne schieldrop , chief commodities analyst with seb bank , adding that further upward revisions might follow .

documents.title: inside the fox empire
text: we 've also made a visual representation detailing the fox empire

documents.title: wall street opens on a high
text: us shares opened on a high on thursday , on the confirmation that walt disney is to buy most of rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox for $ 52.4bn ( £ 39bn ) .
the dow jones is up 0.24 % or 58.9 points to 24,644.29 , with boeing up 1.5 % to $ 296.10 , still riding on its big dividend announcement .

the s & p 500 is up 0.12 % or 3.3 points to 2,666.08 , led by tiffany & co , up to 3.7 % to $ 99.62 on the news it has signed a an agreement with luxottica to develop and distribute a line of sunglasses under the tiffany & co brand .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has risen 0.18 % or 12 points to 6,887.85 , led by riot blockchain , up 11.6 % to $ 25.70 as investors see it as a way to join in the bitcoin mania gripping wall street .

documents.title: does sky news have a future ?
text: bob iger , disney 's chief executive , has indicated that sky news might not be canned after all .
when asked directly , he told bloomberg tv : `` absolutely .
all of sky has a future .

`` we obviously will look at the overlap between the business that are similar ultimately we believe we 're going to create a lot of opportunities for a lot of fox employees , opportunities beyond the ones they have today . ''

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks to karen and russell for this morning 's live coverage of all things business .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views .
got a point of view ?
tweet me at @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: mnangagwa calls for lifting of sanctions
text: zimbabwe 's new president emmerson mnangagwa has called for the removal of political and economic sanctions imposed by western countries and indicated that elections due in july could be brought forward .
speaking to the leadership of the ruling zanu-pf party , mr mnangagwa said sanctions were crippling zimbabwe 's national development and he called for them to be lifted unconditionally .
he also said the government would do all in its power to ensure that elections were credible , free and fair , adding that the vote was 'nearer than you expect '' .
mr mnangagwa became president last month after robert mugabe , who ruled zimbabwe for 37 years , was removed from office .

documents.title: niki lauda could buy back airline
text: ex-formula one champion niki lauda says he is interested in buying back the collpased airline he founded .
austria-based nikki ceased operations late on wednesday after opening insolvency proceedings .
the country 's aviation authorities have begun organising the repatriation of an estimated 5,000 passengers stranded by the grounding of the airline , a division of air berlin .
this followed an announcement by germany 's lufthansa that it was no longer interested in buying niki together with the rest of air berlin because of eu competition concerns .
lauda sold his airline to air berlin in 2011 .

documents.title: a graphic illustration of media empires
text: wondering how big the disney media empire is ?
here it is explained visually

documents.title: sky expects fox takeover to go through
text: the disney deal to buy 21st century fox also includes fox 's 39 % stake in broadcaster sky .
but of course sky is in the midst of its own acquisition drama - as 21st century fox has agreed to buy the remainder of sky .

sky has now put out a statement : `` prior to the close of the transaction , it is anticipated that 21st century fox will seek to complete its planned acquisition of the 61 % of sky it does n't already own . ''
it added that 21st century fox remained `` fully committed '' to completing the current sky offer , which it expected it to be finalised by 30 june , 2018 .

documents.title: james murdoch 's future
text: walt disney chief executive bob iger has not ruled out a role for james murdoch ( above ) following the takeover of 21st century fox .
rupert murdoch 's son and right hand man had been tipped for a top job in the merged media empire , but today 's announcement made not mention of him .
but iger told abc 's good morning america programme : `` james and i will be talking over the next couple of months .
he will be integral to the integration process .
he and i will be discussing whether there is a role for him or not at our company . ''

documents.title: pipeline crack safety cordon halved
text: a safety cordon around one of the uk 's most important oil pipelines has been halved as a crack which was discovered has not grown .
the forties pipeline carries crude north sea oil across sea and land for processing at grangemouth .
the crack was discovered last week near netherley in aberdeenshire and a 300m safety cordon was in place .
operator ineos said the crack had not grown for 48 hours , so the safety cordon had been reduced to 150m .
industry body oil and gas uk has said the resulting lost production is worth around £ 20m per day .
read more here

documents.title: four seasons resolution months away
text: a refinancing deal for four seasons care homes could still be many months away following today 's `` standstill agreement '' over a critical debt payment .
under the agreement , four seasons and its largest creditor , h/2 capital , have until 2 april next year to approve a financial restructuring .
only then would a deal be put before other major debtors .
four seasons operates 343 care homes , but only just more than 20 are thought to be profitable .

documents.title: drugs giant to cut 14,000 jobs
text: israeli pharma giant teva pharmaceutical industries is to slash its workforce by more than a quarter as part of a plan to repay its massive debts .
teva - which is the world 's biggest generic drugmaker - said 14,000 posts will go worldwide .
the shake-up is designed to cut teva 's costs by $ 3bn ( £ 2.2bn ) by the end of 2019 .
israel 's main trade union says it will hold a half-day general strike on sunday in protest at the job cuts .
teva has debts totalling almost $ 35bn following its acquisition of allergan 's actavis generic drug business for $ 40.5bn .
it has been making changes since kare schultz joined as chief executive on 1 nov .

documents.title: eurozone rates on hold
text: as expected , the european central bank has kept interest rates for countries in the eurozone unchanged , with the main rate held at zero .
the ecb also confirmed it would cut the amount of assets it is buying each month under its quantitative easing programme from €60bn to €30bn in january .
this move had previously been announced in october .
attention now switches to ecb president mario draghi 's news conference , where he will discuss the reasons behind the bank 's latest decision .

documents.title: breakingstay of execution for four seasons
text: the uk 's second biggest care home provider four seasons health care and investor h/2 capital partners have agreed a `` standstill '' over an imminent debt payment .
troubled four seasons is in the process of refinancing , and will not make the december payment in order to maintain `` appropriate liquidity for its operations '' , the companies announced .

documents.title: all about bob
text: it seems that having bob iger stay on as the boss of disney was crucial to sealing the $ 52.4bn deal to buy 21st century fox 's entertainment assets .

disney 's lead independent director orin smith , says : `` when considering this strategic acquisition , it was important to the board that bob remain as chairman and chief executive through 2021 to provide the vision and proven leadership required to successfully complete and integrate such a massive , complex undertaking .

`` we share the belief of our counterparts at 21st century fox that extending his tenure is in the best interests of our company and our shareholders , and will be critical to disney 's ability to effectively drive long-term value from this extraordinary acquisition . ''
there had been speculation that james murdoch , chief executive of 21st century fox , would be named as the successor to mr iger .
but curiously , there is no mention of james in today 's announcement .

documents.title: mpc minutes 'fairly dull '
text: ben brettell , senior economist at hargreaves lansdown said the minutes of the mpc meeting were `` fairly dull '' .

he added : `` brexit is highlighted as the most significant influence on the economic outlook , with the minutes noting the trade-off between setting interest rates to control inflation and setting them to provide support to jobs and growth . ''
with the brexit-related uncertainty `` almost certainly here to stay '' , mr brettell said he expected the bank to `` proceed cautiously from here '' .
and he too thinks the next rate rise is likely to come later in 2018 .
`` policymakers will naturally be keen to raise rates as fast as the economy allows , if only to provide some firepower when the next economic downturn arrives .
`` but with domestic inflationary pressures thin on the ground and brexit casting its customary shadow , there 's no real imperative to move for some time .
markets are tentatively pricing in a further rise towards the second half of next year , '' he added .

documents.title: uk broadcasters see shares rise
text: disney 's commitment to pursue 21st century fox 's bid for the remaining shares in sky that it does not own saw shares in the uk company perk up .
sky shares had been languishing about 0.5 % down until the midday news , when they jumped to stand 1 % higher .
shares in bt , a sky rival in sports broadcasting , were up 2.4 % - about where they started the day .
itv shares spiked 0.5 % after the news .

documents.title: 'vital ' to keep cost of borrowing low , says iodmore from the institute of directors
text: workers continue to see limited growth in their pay packets , which is acting as a straitjacket on consumer spending , whilst businesses are struggling to find the additional capacity to accommodate inflation-busting wages .
meanwhile , despite progress on brexit negotiations , much work is still to be done to lift firms ' optimism .

as such , lower for longer should be the bank 's mantra for the time being : it 's absolutely vital now to keep the cost of credit low whilst households are squeezed and businesses navigate ongoing investment uncertainty .

documents.title: bosses welcome interest rate decision
text: after rocking the boat last month , the bank of england 's decision to hold the interest rate , though not unexpected , is welcome .
inflation has reached a near six-year high and the data points to reducing slack in the labour market , but it 's still too early to wean the economy off low interest rates .

that 's because , firstly , price increases are likely to have peaked over this quarter anyway - as the inflationary effect of the weaker currency passes through - and secondly low interest rates provide an important lifeline for belt-tightening households and businesses in a period of uncertainty .

documents.title: next rate hike in august 2018 ?
text: expert comment on the interest rate decision is starting to trickle through now with rhys herbert , senior economist at lloyds bank commercial banking saying : `` as expected the mpc voted unanimously to leave interest rates unchanged in december .
having voted to raise rates in november the committee will now wait to assess the impact of this and other uncertainties facing the uk economy .
`` we expect that the mpc will raise interest rates again next year but there were no hints today as to when that will occur .
`` we think august 2018 is the most likely date for the next hike . ''

documents.title: fox to carry on with sky bid
text: today 's announcement says that 21st century fox will still attempt to complete its planned acquisition of the 61 % of sky it does n't already own .
the competition and markets authority is investigating the deal on grounds of media plurality .

the statement says : `` 21st century fox remains fully committed to completing the current sky offer and anticipates that , subject to the necessary regulatory consents , the transaction will close by 30 june , 2018 .

`` assuming 21st century fox completes its acquisition of sky prior to closing of the transaction , the walt disney company would assume full ownership of sky , including the assumption of its outstanding debt , upon closing . ''

documents.title: sterling falls on rates news
text: sterling fell following the announcemnt that uk interest rates were to stay on hold - even though it had been expected .
at 11:55am it stood at $ 1.34.46 .
at 12:05pm it had fallen to $ 1.34.21 .

documents.title: 'modest ' rate rises over next few years
text: the mpc said rates would need to rise gradually .

`` the committee remained of the view that , were the economy to follow the path expected in the november inflation report , further modest increases in bank rate would be warranted over the next few years , '' it said in its statement .

documents.title: disney buys fox
text: disney 's robert iger to remain as chief executive .
the companies hope to complete the deal by 30 june .

documents.title: qe remains on hold
text: the bank of england also said its economic support for the economy via asset purchases - or quantitative easing - would remain the same at £ 435bn .
central banks use qe when interest rates are almost at zero and they need to adopt different tactics to control economic growth - such as pumping money directly into the financial system .

documents.title: breakingmickey mouse buys fox
text: walt disney is buying rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox for $ 52.4bn , the companies have announced .

documents.title: breakinghow did the mpc vote ?
text: all nine members of the monetary policy committee voted in favour of leaving interest rates on hold .

documents.title: breakingno change for uk interest rates
text: as expected , the bank of england has left interest rates unchanged .
policymakers on the monetary policy committee ( mpc ) voted to leave the official bank rate at 0.5 % .
last month , the mpc raised rates by 0.25 % - the first increase in ten years .

documents.title: what 's in a name ?
text: a food charity is backing the owner of a genuine farm called woodside farm - a name tesco has also used on its value pork range since 2016 .
it 's threatening to take legal action if the retail giant does n't drop the brand name woodside farms which it launched last year , reports the guardian .
the feedback charity is calling on major supermarkets to stop using the controversial fake farm '' branding on own-brand meat products .
it says they mislead shoppers .
feedback 's total bull '' campaign says shoppers are being misled with disingenuous '' branding that gives the impression it comes from real farms .
read the guardian 's story here

documents.title: $ 19bn boost for saudi economy
text: king salman of saudi arabia has approved a $ 19bn ( £ 14bn ) plan to stimulate business activity as the country struggles to cope with lower oil export prices .
the aim is to boost the private sector .
much of the money will be used to provide citizens with loans for housing .
other projects will include the development of the kingdom 's broadband network .
analysts say the private sector 's growth has slowed to a crawl on account of austerity measures brought in to curb a state budget deficit .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: shedding light on ebay 's sales
text: with the latest movie in the star wars franchise - the last jedi - due for release in the uk tomorrow , ebay has seized on the opportunity impart some fascinating factoids .
who knew , for example , that one lightsaber has been sold on ebay in the uk every 15 minutes in the past year alone ?
and .
intriguingly , it seems glasgow is the city which has bought the most lightsabers over the last eight years in the uk , followed by manchester and bristol .

if you do n't already have enough fodder for chit chat at the office christmas party , ebay also tells us that three fans per second searched for star wars merchandise in 2015 following the release of star wars : the force awakens .

documents.title: sports direct : management 's distractionsshares down almost 9 %
text: back to one of our earlier stories , now with some expert comment on the sports direct results .

sports direct 's corporate governance practices continue to attract headlines for all the wrong reasons , with independent shareholders rejecting an £ 11m payment to mike ashley 's brother on wednesday .
unfortunately the lack of transparency also stretches to the selfridges of sport '' initiative .
mike ashley has described trading at the new format stores as spectacular '' , but it 's difficult to see evidence of that in the numbers .
improved profits are being driven by cost cuts rather than sales growth - which is actually negative in the uk .
the tail of strategic stakes and small regional operations continues to grow .
at a time when the company is undertaking a major revamp of its core uk operations it 's difficult to imagine that this is n't a distraction for management . ''

documents.title: pound eases higher ahead of interest rate news
text: sterling has edged higher as traders await a bank of england meeting that will be watched for signs of whether recent progress in brexit talks and higher uk inflation could speed up the pace of future interest rate hikes .
the bank will announce at noon uk time if interest rates are to rise - although the vast majority of experts say no change is expected .
the pound hit the day 's high of $ 1.3467 after the retail sales data , before slipping back to $ 1.3447 .
against the euro , the pound was up a quarter of a percent on the day at 87.91 pence .

documents.title: no return for pre-crisis property scramble
text: the trade body for mortgage lenders says there will be no return of the scramble for properties seen before the financial crisis , for at least the next two years .
the number of property transactions is expected to remain at about 1.2 million for each of the next two years , according to uk finance .
it expects a slight rise in lending next year compared with its previous forecast .
first-time buyer activity was more buoyant than it had expected this year , owing mainly to government schemes aimed at helping people buy their first home .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: retail sales : what the experts say
text: `` november 's retail sales figures have seen stronger than expected in sales values the fact that there has been any growth at all should be commended .
the next ten days of pre-christmas sales will be crucial .
some retailers will do better than others and , given the growing cost pressures facing both the industry and consumers , there is little room for error . ''
ian geddes , head of retail , deloitte
`` the surge in retail sales in november does not signal broader consumer strength .
the official data are failing to fully adjust for the new seasonal pattern generated by black friday , which only gained traction in the uk three years ago . ''
samuel tombs , chief uk economist , pantheon macroeconomics
`` consumer confidence seems to have recovered from the shocks which hit retail spending earlier this year - rising inflation and increased uncertainty surrounding the brexit process .
these november figures provide some encouragement that consumer spending will end the year on a more positive note . ''
andrew sentance , senior economic adviser , pwc .

documents.title: retail sales : it 's relativechief business economist at ihs markit tweets :
text: +1.6 % annual uk retail sales growth in november : better than expected but looks disappointing in context of weak october and average of +3.6 % over prior four years
always counter good news with bad when it comes to uk .
trying to ascertain the extent to which this is 'good news ' .
let 's just not get too excited by this

documents.title: delay for new debt protection
text: plans to protect people in persistent debt from further difficulties have been delayed .
the financial conduct authority has drawn up plans that would see customers in persistent debt for 12 months not receiving offers of credit limit increases .
credit card companies would also put people on repayment plans when they are paying more in interest and charges than actually paying back the debt .
however , a further consultation with the industry means the new scheme has been delayed by a few months .
the regulator 's earlier research found that 1.4 million people in the uk have only made the minimum repayments on their credit cards for three years in a row .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: sales rise leaves shares underwhelmed
text: share prices in the major retailers have barely flinched in reaction to news of a rise in retail sales .
that 's probably because november 's rise included black friday , with most sales done online .
tesco shares were down 0.4 % , while sainsbury was flat - but off its earlier low .
m & s was 0.13 % off , next remained about 0.5 % lower .

documents.title: food shoppers spending more on less
text: the increase in food prices ( see previous post ) has resulted in a fall of 0.1 % in the quantity bought compared with november last year , says the ons , and an increase of 3.5 % in the amount spent .

documents.title: food prices push higher
text: prices also rose strongly in november .
total average store prices increased by 3.1 % in november compared with the same period last year .
there were price increases across all store types , in particular food stores which the ons said saw the largest price increase since september 2013 at 3.6 % .

documents.title: retail sales riseinvestec 's chief economist tweets :
text: uk nov retail sales up by 1.1 % on the month .
in fact , three of the last four nov numbers have risen in excess of 1 % .
looks like , as yet , the ons is not able to adjust properly for the seasonal effects of 'black friday ' .

documents.title: retail in detail
text: let 's get a bit more detail on those ons figures on retail sales
0.8 % growth in retail sales in sept-nov 2017 compared with the previous 3 months
0.9 % growth in november 2017 , compared to 2.1 % in november 2016 .
given the importance of consumer spending in the uk economy it is difficult to see how q4 gdp can match q4 2016
1.1 % rise in retail quantity bought in nov 2017 compared with october , with household goods stores up 2.9 %

documents.title: black friday boost for sales
text: underlying retail sales growth remained reasonably strong in the last few months .
household goods stores had a good november , with a number of businesses saying that black friday promotions boosted sales .

documents.title: retail sales jump in november
text: uk retail sales rose by 1.6 % in november , compared with the same month last year , according to the latest figures .
the office for national statistics included this year 's black friday sales on 24 november .

the ons said : `` retailers ' feedback suggests that black friday '' events contributed to the monthly increase in household goods stores , with electrical household appliances making the largest contribution to the growth . ''
the increase follows a fall of 0.3 % in october from a year earlier , according to the ons , the first annual fall since march 2013 .

documents.title: steinhoff problems grow
text: pressure on retailer steinhoff continues to mount .
the south african company , which owns poundland and harveys furniture in the uk , announced last night that it was restating its 2016 accounts .
it follows disclosure that some of its 2017 financial statements are under scrutiny .
shares steinhoff , which has its primary listing in frankfurt , fell as much as 12 % at the start of trading .
the price has plunged since the accounting revelations were revealed .

documents.title: lonmin shares jump on investor relief
text: shares in lonmin soared by 21 % to 77.25p after the platinum miner said it had agreed to a takeover by south african rival sibanye-stillwater for £ 285m .

investec analyst marc elliott said the deal was `` welcome news to long suffering lonmin shareholders averting the need to dig into their pockets once again to refinance the company in its regular three to four year refinancing cycle . ''

documents.title: net neutrality - why does it matter ?
text: on thursday , the federal communications commission ( fcc ) is expected to decide on whether to repeal an obama-era law that protects `` net neutrality '' .
it refers to the principle that all traffic on the internet is treated equally .
without laws protecting the principles , campaigners say internet service providers ( isps ) will have free rein to exploit new power by throttling certain types of internet traffic .
for example , an isp may decide to charge extra to use a service such as netflix , or give a company an upper hand by not counting use of certain services when charging users for data bandwidth .
such moves are theoretical , but until now were prevented by law .
so just what is net neutrality ?
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: no deal at wto in buenos aires
text: ministers from the world trade organization 's 164 member countries have wrapped up a meeting in buenos aires with the wto 's boss , roberto azevedo expressing disappointment about the outcome .
member countries , he said in his closing speech , did not manage final substantive agreements .

the european union trade commissioner cecilia malmstrom said , referring to one particular area where an agreement had been sought , the sad reality is that we did not even agree to stop subsidizing illegal fishing '' .
it 's certainly a setback for the wto , though not very surprising .

one of the big issues hanging over this meeting was a concern felt by many trade officials that the us under president trump is much less engaged with the wto as a forum for managing international trade .
that said mr azevedo said there had been important progress in some areas .
author: Andrew Walker
World Service economics correspondent

documents.title: capita shares tumble
text: investors have run for cover after outsourcing firm capita warned that trading conditions remain `` challenging '' .
the shares were down 12 % , adding to a slow slide since the summer .
capita , which operates the london congestion charge , said the market for major management contacts remains `` subdued '' , particularly in the public sector .
it also flagged potential problems in its private sector partnerships division .
the firm still expects underlying profits to rise `` modestly '' in the second half of 2017 , but it cautioned over a raft of one-off charges , as well as restructuring costs under an overhaul .

documents.title: budget day in scotland
text: scotland 's finance secretary is expected to confirm income tax rises for middle and higher earners when he unveils his draft budget for next year .
derek mackay will say the increase in taxation is needed to raise more money to help protect public services .
but it will see many people in scotland pay more income tax than those on the same salary elsewhere in the uk .
the scottish government was given powers over income tax rates and bands last year .
read the full story here

documents.title: sports direct shares sink
text: sports direct shares slide more than 7 % at the start of trading after investors reacted negatively to the retailer 's latest profit figures .
profits fell after the company was hit by acquisition and foreign exchange costs .
london 's main share index drifted lower at the start of trading .
shortly after the open the ftse 100 was down 0.18 % at 7,482 points , with standard chartered , down 2 % , the main failer .
ahead of news expected later that media mogul rupert murdoch is selling some assets , broadcaster sky was up 0.1 % .
sky 's sports broadcasting rival bt led the blue chip risers , up 2 % .
outside the top flight , ocado was 0.38 % lower after the online grocer posted a rise in sales .
the ftse 250 opened 0.39 % down at 19,983 points .

documents.title: bp 's australia petrol deal blocked by watchdog
text: australia 's competition watchdog will block bp 's $ 1.3b ( £ 1.04b ) plans to buy a network of local petrol stations from supermarket chain woolworths .
the australia competition and consumer commission said thursday it opposed the deal over fears it would drive up fuel prices .
last year bp said it would buy , rebrand and operate woolworths ' existing 531 fuel and convenience stores , plus 12 sites under construction .
but competition concerns could scupper the deal .
`` the bottom line is that we consider motorists will end up paying more , regardless of where they buy fuel , if this acquisition goes ahead , '' accc chairman rod sims said .

documents.title: another reason to love star wars
text: as if there were n't already a million reasons to love star wars , here 's another - it gives a big boost to the uk economy .
the office for national statistics reckons that movies such as star wars : the last jedi and paddington 2 have helped the uk film and television industry contribute £ 7.7bn to the economy in 2016 .
some of star wars was filmed at pinewood studios while the adventures of everyone 's favourite marmalade sandwich-eating peruvian bear were recorded up and down the country .
as well as a couple of hours of escapism , the industry also provides jobs .
last year , 60,000 people were working in films .

documents.title: cleaning up laundry services
text: two laundry companies , whose clients include the nhs , have been fined for breaching competition rules .
micronclean and berendsen cleanroom agreed not to compete against each in certain areas .
the competition and markets authority fined the companies a total of £ 1.7m , £ 1.1m of which is levied on berendsen .
`` market-sharing agreements are well established and serious breaches of competition law , '' said ann pope , cma senior director for antitrust enforcement .

`` organisations like the nhs rely on the cleanroom laundry services provided by these companies , but we have found the two biggest players were dividing customers between them , leaving those customers with very little choice in service provider . ''

documents.title: what is lonmin ? lonmin bought for £ 285m by sibanye-stillwater
text: lonmin used to be one of the biggest names in corporate britain - seldom out of the business pages .
it was founded in 1909 as the london and rhodesian mining and land company ( lonrho ) .
tiny rowland became chief executive in 1962 .
under his leadership lonrho became involved in a controversial battle to buy harrods .
it also owned the observer newspaper between 1981 and 1993 .
in the late nineties the conglomerate was split in two and , in 1999 , one part was renamed lonmin and focused once more on mining .
lonmin is joint listed on the stock markets in london and johannesburg and it is the world 's third-biggest platinum producer .
in 2012 , 34 striking miners were shot dead at lonmin 's marikana platinum mine near rustenburg in south africa .

documents.title: murdoch 'must have something up his sleeve '
text: so why is rupert murdoch selling his entertainment assets , leaving himself with a much smaller business ?
`` we thought the whole empire was getting bigger and bigger so it could be passed on to the children at some point , '' says stuart purvis a former editor of itn .
`` he must have a better idea , he must have something up his sleeve , ''
mr purvis also points out that the deal is likely to leave the murdoch 's with a 5 % stake in disney .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'disney not very interested in news '
text: walt disney could end up as the owner of sky news here in the uk .
how would hit handle that ?
stuart purvis was a former editor of itn and was also senior advisor at ofcom , the media regulator .
he has dealt with most of the american networks over the last 30 years and says that disney has never been very interested in news .
`` they inherited a news business when they took over the abc network .
abc news is a profitable part of a network and disney has done nothing to diminish that .
however he points out that the owner of mickey mouse can be ruthless .
mr purvis was a director of a company that disney inherited a stake in - a tv news syndication business - disney was not interested and it was soon sold on .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: lonmin bought for £ 285m
text: miner lonmin has agreed to be taken over by south african miner sibanye-stillwater .
the deal values lonmin at about £ 285m .

in a statement lonmin said its board believed the deal was in the `` best interests '' of lonmin shareholders and its stakeholders and `` provides lonmin with a comprehensive and sustainable solution to the adverse challenges it faces .

`` the combination of sibanye-stillwater and lonmin creates a larger and more resilient company , with greater geographical and commodity diversification , that is better able to withstand short-term commodity price and foreign exchange volatility . ''

documents.title: sports direct : profits healthy , says ashley
text: controversy around sports direct has done nothing to dent its profits .
the retailer has posted half-year underlying pre-profits up 22.9 % to £ 88m .
this figure strips out one-off losses on acquisitions and foreign exchange movements .
if these are included , however , pre-tax profits for the six months to the end of october slumped 67 % compared with the same period last year to £ 45.8m .
total group revenue rose 4.7 % to £ 1.7bn , although at the uk stores it fell 1 % to £ 1.1bn .

chief executive mike ashley said in a statement : '' whilst our reported profit before tax has been impacted by fair value adjustments and transitional factors such as the disposal of assets in fy17 ; our underlying profit before tax remains healthy . ''

documents.title: asia stocks soft after fed
text: markets in asia drifted lower after the us federal reserve delivered its third interest rate hike for the year .
japan 's nikkei 225 index closed down 0.3 % , or 63.32 points , at 22,694.45 .
australia 's s & p/asx 200 index shed 0.2 % , or 10.5 points , to end at 6,011.3 , while south korea 's kospi index lost 0.5 % , or 11.07 points , to close at 2,469.48 .
hong kong 's hang seng ended the morning session flat .

documents.title: ocado sales up by nearly 12 %
text: sales at online grocer ocado rose by 11.6 % to £ 373.8m in the 14 weeks to 3 december .
average orders per week also rose from 250,00 to 280,000 - an 11.1 % increase .
meanwhile the average order size went from £ 105.83 to £ 106.11 - a rise of 0.3 % .

tim steiner , ocado 's chief executive officer , said : `` while we continue to report sector leading double digit sales growth in our retail business , a shortage of capacity , with the lack of drivers in certain locations being the largest factor , restricted our sales growth .
`` while this driver shortage has now been largely resolved , there was some short term impact on average orders per week over the period . ''

documents.title: will disney take on amazon and netflix ?
text: walt disney 's deal to buy the film , television and international businesses from rupert murdoch 's twenty-first century fox could be confirmed today .
it 's a strange deal on several levels , not least because murdoch is rarely a seller of businesses and disney would own 40 % of the uk 's sky news .
`` it 's about scale and content , '' michael hewson , senior market analyst at cmc markets tells today .
`` for disney it could be their way of dealing with the threat of amazon and netflix , because fox owns a stake in [ streaming service ] hulu .
`` i think it is the opening shots of disney to take on those big two . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: it 's in the postbbc business presenter tweets
text: if you thought you were going to be busy today , spare a thought for the posties
it 's the busiest day of the year for royal mail as we send our christmas cards and parcels .
how are they coping ?
i 'm finding out on @ twitterid
`` busiest day of the year '' ?
so funny , we 've not had any postal service since last friday !
amazon can deliver , as can tesco and asda but not the post office it seems .
most likely they are having a breakdown , considering they ca n't even deliver post on a normal time of year on time .
i 'm doing them a favour by not sending any .
chocolate sent to family in usa yesterday b4 deadline , they ate the first parcel and that was a lot !
major q in post office.luckily im retired !
ho ho ho !
handwriting comment hit home .
my mother says mine looks like attempts by a 3 yr old with a crayon .
i 've even started using a fountain pen !
i only ever type

documents.title: called to account
text: continuing the theme of money and morality
michael hewson , chief market analyst at cmc markets , tells today that he left banking because `` targets were the be-all and end-all , and there was no personal responsibility '' .
there should be no need to `` park your morality at the door '' when you enter the world of finance .
`` one of the reasons there is this crisis of capitalism is that we had the credit crunch , and rather than let these banks fail we bailed them out .
no one was held accountable , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: following the fed ?
text: china 's central bank raises interest rates after fed rise

documents.title: morality and money
text: david walker , bishop of manchester and deputy chair of the church commissioners , has been talking to today about global financial markets and making money .
there are still people who think that the church commissioners ' £ 8bn investment fund does not sit comfortably with its religious objectives .
should n't the fund be sold and the money given to the poor ?
`` we are effectively giving money to the poor , '' bishop walker says .

`` about half the money goes on pensions to the clergy , who have served long and hard over the years , and much of the other half goes to supporting ministries in the poorer parts of the country . ''
about one-fifth of the fund is invested in global equities .
he acknowledges that share prices are `` at the top end '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: transition or adaptation ?
text: two years is the length of time commonly talked about for a transition deal , but the treasury select committee says if it needs longer to get the right need , then it should be allowed to .
`` the evidence that we have had is that people may then need a further 'adaptation ' period , '' nicky morgan told wake up to money .
`` that means that there are some sectors where new regimes and regulations are going to have to be put in place , so for example , there might well be new financial services legislation .

`` it would be for chemicals or pharmaceuticals , it could be for specific sectors where they say 'look we understand we 've got this transition period of two years , but actually we 're going to just need a further short period of time in which to get this particular body up and running ' . ''

documents.title: deal of no deal ?
text: prime minister theresa may is off to brussels today to agree a brexit divorce bill and the terms for the uk leaving the eu .

nicky morgan , chair of the treasury select committee , was on wake up to money to discuss her committee 's recommendation that the negotiations need to get a transitional trade deal agreed within weeks because it would be in the overwhelming interests of the uk and the eu .

ms morgan said while the british public had taken the decision to leave the european union , people `` did n't want mass uncertainty , people 's jobs to be at risk , for our economy to be significantly smaller , for businesses not to know which way they are turning '' .
`` that 's why this transitional period is important '' .
so just what is the `` transitional period ? ''

it 's where everything pretty much stays the same in the relationship between the uk and the eu but the uk is free to negotiate its own trade deals with other countries while still being a member of the single market .
`` we will be , according to the eu , a third country once we have got to beyond march 2019 and therefore that would mean we should be in a position to negotiate those relationships , '' she added .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: faking it ? bbc singapore business reporter tweets
text: fraud and hoaxes are n't anything new .
but the internet is helping to spread misinformation more quickly and cheaply than ever .
the director of @ twitterid research told me creating # fakenews costs as little as $ 1000 and these three elements # icymi @ twitterid
my tweet is missing the word 'contains ' in another example of why tired , time-constrained journos need an edit function

documents.title: brexit transition deal is urgent , say select committee mps
text: an influential group of mps has urged britain and the european union to agree a `` status quo '' transition period following britain 's departure from the eu .
the treasury select committee said that the temporary arrangement should be agreed as quickly as possible to ease business concerns over a `` no deal '' brexit .
the committee 's report said it `` strongly supported '' the prime minister 's push for a comprehensive free trade deal which would keep borders as `` frictionless '' as possible .
but it said in order to reach that point , an implementation period would be necessary where the european court of justice ( ecj ) was likely to retain supremacy over uk laws .
read the full story here
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: bank could 'get away ' with rate rise
text: ahead of the interest rate decision at midday , michael hewson , chief market analyst at cmc markets was on wake up to money .
he said the bank of england 's monetary policy committee ( mpc ) is n't going to raise interest rates any time soon .
however , he thinks that with inflation at 3.1 % - far above the government-set target of 2 % `` we could get away with pushing interest rates up again `` .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to thursday 's business live .
coming up : in the us , the fed raised interest rates yesterday and today is decision day for the policymakers in the uk .
will they , wo n't they follow suit ?
probably not , but as ever we 'll keep you up to date on the thinking behind the decision making .
at 7am we 'll get interim results from sports direct and a trading update from ocado .
and in early afternoon disney is expected to announce it 's buying a big chunk of 21st century fox .
it 's been widely trailed - but today could be the day .
do stick with us if you can for all that and the rest of the day 's news .
